title: Brooklyn Tequila Fest
description: Tequila and mezcal enthusiasts—come discover, sip, and savor something new at the Brooklyn Tequila Fest! With more than 100 styles of tequila, mezcal, spirits, cocktails, and more, it’s a perfect chance to hang with friends and chat with distillers and representatives about the craft behind your next favorite go-to pours. Guests can enjoy unlimited samples all night, plus live entertainment, interactive games, and access to food available for purchase from Angry Archies, Chavas Empanadas, Mozzarepas, Taste of Poland, and more.
address: Brooklyn Navy Yard Building 77 Waterfront Promenade, 141 Flushing Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11205

title: Sixties Surreal at the Whitney
description: A new exhibition at the Whitney Museum explores how artists in 1960s America used surrealism to respond to the era's social and political changes. The show features works by more than 100 artists, including Diane Arbus, Romare Bearden, and Yayoi Kusama.
address: Whitney Museum of American Art, Meatpacking District
cost: $30 general, $24 seniors/students, free for 25 and under, free to all every Friday 5-10pm, free to all every second Sunday.

title: Seventh Annual Mobile Dance Film Festival
description: The Mobile Dance Film Festival, the first film festival to screen dance films shot solely on mobile devices, returns with 10 new shorts.
address: 280 Broadway Gibney: Agnes Varis Performing Arts Center, Civic Center/Tribeca

title: Opera Italiana in Central Park: Opera Unbound: A Sunset Serenade
description: Opera is in the air at Central Park’s Naumburg Bandshell, where conductor Alvise Casellati leads soprano Leah Hawkins, tenor Murat Karahan, and members from the Met Opera, NY Philharmonic, Juilliard, and the Manhattan School of Music in an outdoor performance of selections by Verdi, Leoncavallo, Mascagni, Puccini, and Rossini.

title: Letters + Sodas: LIC Reading Series
description: Writer Lana Schwartz brings together comedians and writers for a night of standup, humor pieces, fiction, and essay readings at the Greats of Craft (LIC).

title: Not in My Backyard! A Political Comedy Roundtable
description: A panel of opinionated NYC comedians, journalists, and politicians debate the local issues causing drama in your neighborhood’s Facebook group.

title: Artists + Beers
description: Pair cinema with cervezas at 'Artists + Beers,' a semi-monthly screening series highlighting short films, docs, and music videos by local filmmakers.

title: We Have Fun: A Stand-Up Show
description: Hosts Zach Sims and Dan Wilbur team up to bring the fun-ny to Young Ethel’s, with stand-up by Laura Lane, Kelly Bachman, Jonathan Van Halem, Max Fine, and Lizzie High.

title: Comedy on Kingston
description: The Comedy on Kingston show returns with a night of stand up featuring Emma Willmann, Jenny Zigrino, Murahd Shawki, Simeon Goodson, and Pat Burtscher.

title: Fightin’ Words! A Language Game Show
description: Three contestants compete in a series of word-based games to win the ultimate prize: a new word of their creation will be added to the people’s lexicon.
